Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Jar stand
Description: Asymmetrical jar stand with a triangular lip at the base and a flaring upper section, which ends in a simple lip in continuation of the body. The clays is fine: Nile clay with a variety of fine tempers. Although the stand has been polished, throwing marks are still visible.
